Wet Area - Shower wall extents confirmed
Wet Area - Shower angle location confirmed
Wet Area - All pipes and wastes to be grouted firm
Tag 1: All pipes and wastes to be grouted firm,

Name: Wet Area - Concrete Patched, Any projections ground
Wet Area - Positive falls to waste
Wet Area - Sheet gaps are no greater than 10mm
Tag 1: Sheet gaps are no greater than 10mm

Name: Wet Area - Screws, External/internal corners set
Wet Area - Ensure area is dry
Wet Area - Substrate scraped free from concrete/Plaster
Tag 1: Substrate is scraped free from concrete/Plaster Remove any excessive projections that may interfere with the membrane

Name: Wet Area - Substrate is clean/smooth/firm/continuous surface
Tag 1: Substrate is Vacuumed/Broomed clean, smooth, firm, continuous surface and free from loose or foreign matter

Name: Wet Area - Prime floors, upturns & shower walls
Tag 1: Prime all floors, upturns and shower walls with GCP Epocote F100W Primer or GCP Silcor Primer BS

Name: Wet Area - Fill any penetrations/voids flush
Tag 1: Fill any penetrations / voids flush to ensure a continuous surface, apply coving fillet of Polyurethane Sealant to all floor/wall junctions and pipe collars

Name: Wet Area - Membrane installed to entire floor area
Tag 1: Membrane installed to entire floor area at minimum 100mm turnup – GCP Silcor 560 HB applied in two coats at 1.75mm WFT measured using Wet Film Gauge

Name: Wet Area - Cast sand to form to coat for screed As per AS3740
Tag 1: Cast sand to form to coat for screed As per AS3740

Name: Wet Area - Membrane installed to shower walls
Tag 1: Membrane installed to shower walls GCP Newflex at 1.2mm WFT measured using Wet Film Gauge As per AS3740

Name: Wet Area - Allow membrane to cure, check internal corners for dryness
Tag 1: Allow membrane to cure, check internal corners for dryness prior to test Flood entire floor area for 24 hours

Name: Wet Area - No Visual Leaks to surrounds and soffit below
Tag 1: No Visual Leaks to surrounds and soffit below

Name: Wet Area - Check room for defects in the membrane
Tag 1: Check room for defects in the membrane make repairs as necessary and document

Name: Wet Area - QA Complete – ITP signed by relevant parties
Tag 1: QA Complete – ITP signed by relevant parties

Name: Balconies - Set out known extent & location of windows
Tag 1: Set out known ie extent and location of windows with respect to sill

Name: Balconies - Concrete is patched and free of holes on surface
Tag 1: Concrete is patched and free of holes on surface

Name: Balconies - Perform visual check of work area
Tag 1: Perform visual check of work area for:

Name: Balconies - Clean/firm/continuous surface & free from foreign matter
Tag 1: Clean, smooth, firm, continuous surface and free from loose or foreign matter.

Name: Balconies - Any dags of concrete/grout
Balconies - Any penetrations
Balconies - Precast panels are grouted
Balconies - Ensure area is dry
Balconies - Remove dags/projections interfering with membrane
Tag 1: Remove any dags or excessive projections that may interfere with the membrane.

Name: Balconies - Prime all surfaces with Epocote F100W Clear Primer
Tag 1: Prime all surfaces with Epocote F100W Clear Primer

Name: Balconies - Fill penetrations/voids flush to ensure a continuous surface
Tag 1: Fill any penetrations / voids flush to ensure a continuous surface, apply coving fillet of Polyurethane sealant to all internal corners

Name: Balconies - 1st Application: Membrane Application to all upturns
Tag 1: 1st Application: Membrane Application to all upturns prior to painting by others. – GCP Newflex at 1.5mm WFT measured using Wet Film Gauge

Name: Balconies - 2nd Application: coating to all deck areas; ensure lap is achieved
Tag 1: 2nd Application: coating to all deck areas ensuring a lap is achieved to the original turnouts. GCP Newflex at 1.5mm WFT measured using Wet Film Gauge

Name: Balconies - FINAL INSPECTION – check surface for defects in membrane
Tag 1: FINAL INSPECTION – check surface for defects in the membrane, make repairs as necessary /
